articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: Kent Overstreet, the creator of bcachefs, helps us understand where his new filesystem fits, what it's like to upstream a new filesystem, and how they've solved the RAID write hole. Special Guest: Kent Overstreet.
articles.title: 545: 3,062 Days Later

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description:
This challenge gets ugly as we slowly realize we've just become zombie slayers. 
We load Linux on three barely alive systems, and it takes a turn we didn't expect.
articles.title: 544: Half the Bits, Double the Pain

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: We make our big Linux predictions for 2024, but first, we score how we did for 2023. Special Guest: Michael Tunnell.
articles.title: 543: Profoundly Prophetic Prognostications

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: Itâ€™s the fourth annual Unplugged Tuxies; our community votes on the best projects, distros, and desktops of 2023.
articles.title: 542: 2023 Tuxies

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description:
They are building AI into toilets now; CES was a clown show. But we put our business hats on and find the bright side.
Plus, Epic's major loss to Apple that just rolled in, and where we think the next fight will be, and how developers can get ahead of it.
articles.title: 553: Fake AI Until You Make AI

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: A prominent developer has brought the anti-trust heat against Apple to the public, kicking off a chain reaction that could have gone very wrong for Apple. Plus, why the Apple Vision Pro is destined for the Friend Zone.
articles.title: 552: iPad Friend Zone

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: Mike shares his adventures and process of coming from mobile app projects to working with Unreal Engine, and why he realized a laptop just wasn't going to cut it.
articles.title: 551: The Workstation Lifestyle

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: We reflect on how our work has changed over the last year and get some sage advice from buff Uncle Jeff.
articles.title: 550: Buff Uncle Jeff
